pt.runtime

Interface Taskpool

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTaskPool, TaskpoolFIFOWorkSharing, TaskpoolLIFOWorkStealing, TaskpoolMixedScheduling

    public interface Taskpool
    Classes which implement this interface provide specifications regarding scheduling policies such as:
    1- How to deal with tasks that are ready to be executed.
    2- How to enqueue tasks (i.e. adding them to global or private task queues).
    3- How to enqueue multi-task groups.
    4- Different approaches for threads taking tasks from schedule-specific task pools/queues.
    5- Managing different types of task pools/queues.
    Since:
    9/9/2014
    Author:
    Mostafa Mehrabi

      Enqueues the specified TaskInfo as a multi-task, creates "count" inner tasks and places them in a TaskIDGroup which is then returned.

    • Method Detail

      • nowReady

        void nowReady(TaskID<?> taskID)
        The specified task is currently on the waiting queue since it has some dependences. However, all those dependences have now been met and the task is ready to be scheduled for execution.
        Parameters:
        taskID -

      • getActiveInteractiveTaskCount

        int getActiveInteractiveTaskCount()
        Returns the count of currently active interactive tasks. This is usually to know how many threads there are.
        Returns:

      • interactiveTaskCompleted

        boolean interactiveTaskCompleted(TaskID<?> taskID)
        Used to decrement the count of interactive tasks
        Parameters:
        taskID - The task that has just completed

      • enqueue

        <T> TaskID<T> enqueue(TaskInfo<T> taskinfo)
        Enqueues the specified task, whose information is contained in the TaskInfo. It then returns a TaskID to represent that task.
        Parameters:
        taskinfo -
        Returns:

      • enqueueMulti

        <T> TaskIDGroup<T> enqueueMulti(TaskInfo<T> taskinfo)
        Enqueues the specified TaskInfo as a multi-task, creates "count" inner tasks and places them in a TaskIDGroup which is then returned.
        Parameters:
        taskinfo -
        count -
        Returns:

      • workerPollNextTask

        TaskID<?> workerPollNextTask()
        The worker thread polls the task pool for a task.. If there isn't one, then it returns immediately (returns null in such a case).
        Returns:

      • workerTakeNextTask

        TaskID<?> workerTakeNextTask()
        The worker thread blocks until it gets a task to execute.

      • executeSynchronously

        boolean executeSynchronously(int cutOff)

      • getLocalOneoffTaskQueues

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingDeque<TaskID<?>>> getLocalOneoffTaskQueues()
        Used to access local one-off task queues by thread pool at the initialization stage.

      • getPrivateTaskQueues

        java.util.List<java.util.AbstractQueue<TaskID<?>>> getPrivateTaskQueues()
        Used to access private task queues by thread pool at the initialization stage.
